definition: to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist

sentences.english: Efficient without a good soak decontamination vigorously scrub, do not hurt the clothing does not hurt the hand.
sentences.chinese: 高效好泡去污无需大力搓洗，不伤衣物不伤手。

sentences.english: Brunet dress in the oil, tea 8g into can decontamination.
sentences.chinese: 深色衣服上的油渍，用残茶叶搓洗能去污。

sentences.english: Scrub the glass with a wrung-out sponge.
sentences.chinese: 用扭曲的海绵大力搓洗玻璃。

sentences.english: Scrub your hands thoroughly with hot, soapy water before and after handling raw seafood.
sentences.chinese: 在处理生海鲜前后记得用热肥皂水彻底搓洗你的双手。

sentences.english: Try to avoid abrasive soaps, cleansing granules, astringents, and vigorous scrubbing.
sentences.chinese: 避免使用磨砂皂，清洁颗粒，收敛剂及竭尽搓洗。

sentences.english: The colours in this dress won't run if you wash it.
sentences.chinese: 这件连衣裙搓洗时不会掉色。

sentences.english: Scrub the glass, working at all angles to clean the edges.
sentences.chinese: 用力搓洗玻璃，注意要多角度清洁各个边角。

sentences.english: Countless washer women have rubbed the stone away.
sentences.chinese: 数洗搓洗将那块石头磨掉。

definition: to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
